roleset.name: (cause to be) available
roleset.note: FREE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'free' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from free.01-v predicate notes)

roles.note: Arg0 of the verb frame not expected, but should be added if it ever occurs. (from free.01-j)

example.name: prepositional Arg3
example.text: But [the Oct. 17 temblor]-1 put a halt to much nonessential building , and heavy rains last week slowed the rest , [*]-1 freeing construction workers for earthquake repairs .

example.name: Arg3 as a VP
example.text: The New York Times Co. said [0] it reached a settlement with independent home delivery dealers in the metropolitan New York area that [*T*-1]will free the newspaper to expand home delivery circulation .

example.name: with Arg2
example.text: Despite fears [0] the mine may be partially nationalized [*-2]by the new Namibian government following next month 's elections freeing the country from South African control , De Beers engineers are working [*-1] to extend the mine 's productive life for another 25 years , from the current estimate of 10 .

roleset.name: costing nothing
roleset.note: FREE-J NOTES: Added by Julia. (from free.02-j)

example.name: both args
example.text: The popcorn is free of charge when you purchase a ticket

roleset.name: unconstrained, unrestricted
roleset.note: FREE-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on WSJ, free-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls free-80-1. (from free.01-j)

example.name: args 1, 3
example.text: She is free to read whatever she likes.

roleset.name: to make available for other use
roleset.note: FREE_UP-V NOTES: frame edited by Arrick (from free.02-v)

example.name: make available
example.text: And *PRO* freed up that plutonium that *T* was um controlled *-2 for that period of time.
example.arg: that plutonium that *T* was um controlled *-2 for that period of time
